about_the_game:
"Good afternoon applicant 39,064, and welcome to the afterlife. We apologize for the inconvenience, but processing the death of your previous form must be done on your own time. Today, you will be attending new-hire orientation for a recently vacated position here at Lightcorp. Because we here at Lightcorp and all other Infinicorp subsidiaries believe in the benefit of accurate job placement, you will be undergoing some tests before we determine the best place for you. You have been assigned a friendly testing helper by the name of Jamie, who will be assisting you with anything you need - all you need to do is to ask for help. Good luck!" - Management

Story


In Let There Be Light, the player navigates through the offices of Lightcorp, a subsidiary of Infinicorp. In the afterlife, all aspects of the universe are controlled by a capitalism-focused company with a thirst for everyone to conform to their way of life. As the player progresses through the game, they will learn about the megastructure that they have been trapped in as well as both ends of the spectrum of light and dark. The guide, Jamie, is an employee of Lightcorp that is sick of his job and burnt out in every aspect. He hates his afterlife, and you're going to help him see the light in things again. Be careful though, because you could just start to see the darkness as well.

Gameplay


Equipped only with the ability to pick up, rotate, and interact with objects in the world, Let There Be Light requires the player to solve a series of puzzles where positioning, timing, and accuracy matter most. With a plethora of puzzles ranging from simple to advanced, your mind will be tested in nearly every way possible. The goal of the puzzles in this game is not to make you believe that they are unsolvable, but instead to motivate you to find different approaches using new gameplay mechanics along the way.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 - 64 Bit
  • Processor: AMD Ryzen 3 3300X or Equivalent
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia GeForce GTX 1060 or Equivalent
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Storage: 16 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10/11 - 64 Bit
  • Processor: AMD Ryzen 5 3600X or Equivalent
  • Graphics: Nvidia GeForce 2060 or Equivalent
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Storage: 16 MB available space

short_description: Let There Be Light is a physics-based puzzle platformer. Using the complex nature of light and its many forms, you will navigate your way through the capitalism-centered afterlife that awaits all living beings after their demise - with some help from a very stressed employee, of course.
